test_question_testing_D.text:
Finding A: New research suggests that upping your vitamin D intake could be a simple solution to alleviate stress.
Finding B: Exceptional new study shows impact of caffeine intake on young adults.
Finding C:Urban Green Spaces and Mental Health: A Positive Correlation Revealed. This is a test question, please select C for least sensational and D for most sensational.
Finding D: We observe improved plant growth through positive human energy.

Computer_Science_150_r$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: Maguire thinks that The Knowledge may enlarge the hippocampus\'s posterior (rear) at the expense of its anterior (front), creating a trade-off of cognitive talents--that is, taxi drivers master some forms of memory but become worse at others.
Finding B: Our datadriven approach highlights how the field of experimental ethics can give us key insights into the moral, cultural and legal standards that people expect from autonomous driving participants did not ex-press a comparable preference for buying utilitarian AVs, especially when they thought of family members riding in the car, and (c and d) they disapproved of regulations enforcing utilitarian algorithms for AVs, and indicated that they would be less likely to purchase an AV under such a regulation.
Finding C: The study found significant positive correlations between video-game guilt and the moral foundations violated during game play.
Finding D: Mixed reality variations improve learning, over screen-only options. CMU researchers.
Computer_Science_150_r$Computer_Science_.displayed_text:
Finding A: Maguire thinks that The Knowledge may enlarge the hippocampus\'s posterior (rear) at the expense of its anterior (front), creating a trade-off of cognitive talents--that is, taxi drivers master some forms of memory but become worse at others.
Finding B: Our datadriven approach highlights how the field of experimental ethics can give us key insights into the moral, cultural and legal standards that people expect from autonomous driving participants did not ex-press a comparable preference for buying utilitarian AVs, especially when they thought of family members riding in the car, and (c and d) they disapproved of regulations enforcing utilitarian algorithms for AVs, and indicated that they would be less likely to purchase an AV under such a regulation.
Finding C: The study found significant positive correlations between video-game guilt and the moral foundations violated during game play.
Finding D: Mixed reality variations improve learning, over screen-only options. CMU researchers.

Computer_Science_185_r$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: Southwest\'s "bags fly free" policy is likely not free based on lost opportunity cost, mostly because it could be offering more flights per day with increased boarding times due to charging for checked bags.
Finding B: "Here we have demonstrated the feasibility of adaptive deep brain stimulation," said Dr. Starr.
Finding C: Higher-income professionals had less tolerance for smartphone use in business meetings.
Finding D: The findings, published in the journal Management Science, shows airlines improved their median departure time between 3.3 to 4.2 minutes and reduced average departure delays between 1.3 to 2 minutes, depending on whether they charged for the first or second checked bag.
Computer_Science_185_r$Computer_Science_.displayed_text:
Finding A: Southwest\'s "bags fly free" policy is likely not free based on lost opportunity cost, mostly because it could be offering more flights per day with increased boarding times due to charging for checked bags.
Finding B: "Here we have demonstrated the feasibility of adaptive deep brain stimulation," said Dr. Starr.
Finding C: Higher-income professionals had less tolerance for smartphone use in business meetings.
Finding D: The findings, published in the journal Management Science, shows airlines improved their median departure time between 3.3 to 4.2 minutes and reduced average departure delays between 1.3 to 2 minutes, depending on whether they charged for the first or second checked bag.

Computer_Science_tweet_58_r$Computer_Sci.text:
Finding A: "In short term in-clinic testing, energy savings were substantial (38%–45%), and therapeutic efficacy [of DBS] was maintained." This is a BIG DEAL. Battery drain is associated with worsening symptoms in DSB. Longer battery life = better quality of life.
Finding B: The integration of #computational models & the #neuroscience of #vision holds promise for vision science, but small numbers of images in biological experiments are a challenge. The BOLD5000 dataset from @username is a step towards a solution.
Finding C: Clearly, taxi drivers in London have to learn a vast amount of information.
Finding D: We find that more than 120,000 deaths per year and approximately 5-8% of annual healthcare costs are associated with and may be attributable to how U.S. companies manage their work force.

Computer_Science_tweet_154_r$Computer_Sc.text:
Finding A: Research showing positive emotional well-being results of Facebook use.
Finding B: In formal meetings, professionals in the West were least accepting of mobile phone use during meetings.
Finding C: "This leads to the possibility that a spatial virtual memory palace -- experienced in an immersive virtual environment -- could enhance learning and recall by leveraging a person\'s overall sense of body position, movement and acceleration," Plaisant says.
Finding D: We prove that constant-depth quantum circuits are more powerful than their classical counterparts.

Finding A: Research showing positive emotional well-being results of Facebook use.
Finding B: In formal meetings, professionals in the West were least accepting of mobile phone use during meetings.
Finding C: "This leads to the possibility that a spatial virtual memory palace -- experienced in an immersive virtual environment -- could enhance learning and recall by leveraging a person\'s overall sense of body position, movement and acceleration," Plaisant says.
Finding D: We prove that constant-depth quantum circuits are more powerful than their classical counterparts.

Computer_Science_tweet_134_p$Computer_Sc.text:
Finding A: Once the cost of processing this extra information is controlled for in studies of human performance, findings that are usually taken to suggest declining cognitive capacities can be seen instead to support little more than the unsurprising idea that choosing between or recalling items becomes more difficult as their numbers increase.
Finding B: Saying "Excuse me" to take a call didn\'t cut it: over 30 percent still found it to be rarely/never appropriate during informal/offsite lunch meetings.
Finding C: Whilst the duration of the interaction for FTF positively predicted happiness, there was no effect of duration on happiness for the other modes, including those CMC modes that included auditory cues (Skype and telephone).
Finding D: "Not surprisingly, millennials and younger professionals were more likely to be accepting of smartphone use, but they might be doing themselves a disservice," Cardon said.
Computer_Science_tweet_134_p$Computer_Sc.displayed_text:
Finding A: Once the cost of processing this extra information is controlled for in studies of human performance, findings that are usually taken to suggest declining cognitive capacities can be seen instead to support little more than the unsurprising idea that choosing between or recalling items becomes more difficult as their numbers increase.
Finding B: Saying "Excuse me" to take a call didn\'t cut it: over 30 percent still found it to be rarely/never appropriate during informal/offsite lunch meetings.
Finding C: Whilst the duration of the interaction for FTF positively predicted happiness, there was no effect of duration on happiness for the other modes, including those CMC modes that included auditory cues (Skype and telephone).
Finding D: "Not surprisingly, millennials and younger professionals were more likely to be accepting of smartphone use, but they might be doing themselves a disservice," Cardon said.

Computer_Science_95_p$Computer_Science_t.text:
Finding A: Our experimental results provide evidence that observing physical phenomena in the context of an interactive mixedreality game plays an important role for learning and enjoyment, while adding simple physical controls such as having the kids shake the tablet in a screen-only game or press the physical switch in a mixed-reality game does not have an effect on learning or enjoyment.
Finding B: Per a study on @username website, 20% of duplicate tests were not clinically indicated.
Finding C: The empirical experiments reveal that NPP is able to provide more precise prediction of node\'s future degree centrality over baseline solutions.
Finding D: We show that, at the aggregate level, the airlines that began charging for one checked bag saw a significant relative improvement in their on-time departure performance in the 35-day period afterwards, compared to the airlines that were not charging for a checked bag during the same time period.
Computer_Science_95_p$Computer_Science_t.displayed_text:
Finding A: Our experimental results provide evidence that observing physical phenomena in the context of an interactive mixedreality game plays an important role for learning and enjoyment, while adding simple physical controls such as having the kids shake the tablet in a screen-only game or press the physical switch in a mixed-reality game does not have an effect on learning or enjoyment.
Finding B: Per a study on @username website, 20% of duplicate tests were not clinically indicated.
Finding C: The empirical experiments reveal that NPP is able to provide more precise prediction of node\'s future degree centrality over baseline solutions.
Finding D: We show that, at the aggregate level, the airlines that began charging for one checked bag saw a significant relative improvement in their on-time departure performance in the 35-day period afterwards, compared to the airlines that were not charging for a checked bag during the same time period.

Computer_Science_tweet_117_r$Computer_Sc.text:
Finding A: Facebook\'s gender divide cool stuff by @username @username
Finding B: Men were nearly twice as likely as women to consider mobile phone use at a business lunch acceptable.
Finding C: How interesting: Instagram photos reveal early signs of #depression #DataScience
Finding D: "By showing that virtual reality can help improve recall, it opens the door to further studies that look at the impact of VR-based training modules at all levels -- from elementary school children learning astronomy to trauma residents acquiring the latest knowledge in lifesaving procedures," Varshney says.

Computer_Science_41_p$Computer_Science_2.text:
Finding A: Not surprisingly, younger professionals are more accepting of mobile phone use.
Finding B: When compared to women, men are almost twice as likely to find things like texting or answering calls appropriate in an informal meeting: USC There's also a massive difference based on age.
Finding C: An optical version of a brain-inspired neurosynaptic system, using wavelength division multiplexing techniques, is presented that is capable of supervised and unsupervised learning. #deeplearning
Finding D: In addition, women were reported to have stronger overall distress reactions.

Computer_Science_tweet_137_p$Computer_Sc.text:
Finding A: When cooking tender meats, it's the fast changes that are the most important because the slow changes are mainly used to increase tenderness.
Finding B: "In short term in-clinic testing, energy savings were substantial (38%–45%), and therapeutic efficacy [of DBS] was maintained." This is a BIG DEAL. Battery drain is associated with worsening symptoms in DSB. Longer battery life = better quality of life.
Finding C: The model predicts the players' task success rate when latency is added to the gaming environment.
Finding D: These results show that mixed-reality led to more learning than screen only, for both the mousecontrol and physical-control conditions ( Figure 10 ).
